articles.name: Finding the field key or field ID for a custom field
articles.title: Finding the field key or field ID for a custom field
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Suite Team, Growth, Professional, Enterprise, or Enterprise Plus
Support Team, Professional, or Enterprise

When you create a custom ticket field or a custom object field, it is assigned a custom field ID. When you a create custom user field or custom organization field, you designate a custom field key, in addition to the assigned custom field ID.

You need the custom field ID or custom field key to reference custom fields in placeholders and the API. You need the custom field key when bulk importing users and bulk importing organizations.

To find the ID for a custom ticket field
  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Tickets > Fields.
  2. Locate your field in the list.

    The ID is displayed in the Field ID column.

To find the key for a custom user or organization field
  1. Open the page for the type of custom field you are looking for, either a user custom field or an organization custom field:
    • In Admin Center, click People in the sidebar, then select Configuration > User fields.
    • In Admin Center, click People in the sidebar, then select Configuration > Organization fields.
  2. Click the name of the custom field you want to open.
  3. Locate the Field key field.

To find the key for a custom object field

  1. In Admin Center, click Objects and rules in the sidebar, then select Custom objects > Objects.
  2. Click the name of the object.
  3. Click the Fields tab.
  4. Find the field in the list and look at the value displayed in the Field key column.

articles.name: AI Trust at Zendesk
articles.title: AI Trust at Zendesk
articles.body:
Zendesk is committed to building responsible AI across our trusted products and solutions. Zendesk AI is built on our foundational principles of privacy, security, accuracy, transparency and customer control.

AI development

Zendesk develops our AI solutions both internally, by building customized solutions based on our industry-leading expertise in customer service, and by integrating with vetted large language models (LLMs).

Proprietary Models

Zendesk develops our own AI models to meet the nuanced and specific needs of our customers. These models may be trained on customer data to the extent instructed by the customer. Zendesk takes steps to protect data used for model training, including applying data minimization principles, data sanitization techniques, and implementing the same robust technical and organizational controls we apply to all data within our stewardship (see our Enterprise Security Measures).

LLM Integrations

Zendesk unlocks the power of generative AI in our solutions by integrating with reputable third-party LLMs. Before deploying an LLM in Zendesk, we ensure that all customer data processed through the LLM continue to be protected by Zendesk’s robust security requirements. We also rigorously test all prospective LLMs against relevant criteria, such as accuracy, bias, and safety. No LLM is ever deployed within Zendesk without going through these processes.

Privacy

The Zendesk Resolution Platform is designed with privacy at the forefront. Not only do we build solutions to resolve customer and employee service issues, we also invest heavily in building state-of-the-art privacy-enhancing solutions.

Data Minimization Features

Zendesk offers ticket and end-user data deletion schedules right out of the box, regardless of plan. For Advanced Data Privacy and Protection customers with more nuanced data deletion requirements, Zendesk also offers advanced data retention policies, allowing customers to create conditional deletion schedules.

Additionally, all Zendesk customers have access to standard redaction capabilities, so that sensitive ticket content can be permanently redacted. Advanced Data Privacy and Protection customers also have access to our AI-powered redaction suggestions feature, which automatically highlights certain types of data within tickets for agents to quickly redact.

Notice and Consent Features

Zendesk’s privacy layer goes a step beyond data minimization – we also offer features to support GDPR compliance, including native notice options seamlessly embedded into our tools.

For Voice customers, Zendesk offers advanced options for providing notice and/or collecting consent from customers calling service lines. Customers can choose from a simple greeting or require proactive consent to proceed – and all greetings provide standard scripts or can be customized to fit a company’s voice.

For Messaging customers, Zendesk seamlessly embeds a native privacy notice option for customers to surface their legal terms to end-users submitting chats. This allows chat users to be immediately informed of customer privacy practices, deflecting common privacy challenges.

Security

Zendesk views protecting customer data as fundamental to responsible AI development, and has built a robust AI security program. Not only does Zendesk undergo routine security audits and receive certifications from ISO and FedRAMP, but we have developed an AI governance program modeled on the NIST AI Risk Management Framework. This program integrates technical controls, employee policies, AI impact assessments, rigorous testing, and ongoing monitoring into a holistic governance program overseen by company leadership.

The below table provides additional information about specific commitments applicable to both our own models and third-party LLMs:

Transparency and Explainability

Transparency is a cornerstone of AI trust. AI-generated responses which are surfaced directly to end-users are identified, so there it is always clear whether your users are interacting with a human or AI.

We are open about how our AI works, including which data we collect and how it is used. Customers have visibility into AI predictions to guide informed automation decisions. Each AI intent, sentiment, or suggested macro prediction comes with a confidence score, enabling leaders to automate with precision and involve human oversight when needed. For customers using AI Agents - Advanced, Zendesk goes a step further and provides the logic behind an AI agent’s actions, so that customers can understand how AI works and continuously iterate and improve. This transparency builds the foundation of trust between our technology and our customers, ensuring responsible, ethical AI usage.

Zendesk also offers a native AI-powered quality assurance tool that continuously monitors outputs for accuracy, relevance, and quality, so that customers have the information they need to make informed decisions and continuously improve their AI deployments.

Customer Control

Customers always remain in control over when and how they choose to leverage generative AI technology. For example, Copilot AI features are grouped in a centralized AI hub and identified to admins, who have the ability to disable (and re-enable) any feature at their discretion. Generative AI features are also labeled in the Admin Center so that customers know exactly when this technology is deployed, and can disable if they so desire.

Zendesk AI is also designed to accommodate varying degrees of AI adoption based on customer industry or use case. For example, certain customers may prefer leveraging Copilot auto assistance features, which enable AI tools to improve agent productivity but still require human review before interacting directly with end-users. Other customers may wish to deploy next generation AI Agents, powered by agentic AI, to interact directly with end-users based on business procedures. Or a customer might wish to experiment and gradually increase AI automation over time.

Zendesk also ensures that AI outputs surfaced to customers are grounded in customer-defined materials like procedures, policies, and knowledge sources. We use the latest technology like RAG (short for Retrieval Augmented Generation) to ensure that customers remain in control of how AI responds in different scenarios.

Customers are also in control of their data. Not only can they delete and/or redact data in their instances, but they can decide whether or not their data can be used for product improvement purposes.
 

Legal

Zendesk understands that the legal landscape surrounding AI is evolving, but our principles-based approach to AI product design and development enable us to easily adapt to change. At our core, our tools empower customers to meet fundamental principles like data minimization and transparency.

To ensure that we remain on the forefront of the AI regulatory conversation, Zendesk actively participates in the Business Software Alliance, a leading industry policy and advocacy group. This allows Zendesk to stay informed about global AI regulatory developments while also educating legislators about how AI is deployed in our industry and where we see the most significant risks and opportunities for lawmaking.

Zendesk has reviewed new AI policy developments including the EU AI Act, the Colorado Protections for AI Act, and Korea’s AI Basic Act to ensure that Zendesk and our customers are prepared to comply with applicable requirements when they come into effect.

Our observation is that the global AI regulatory trend appears to be coalescing around a risk-based framework, with the majority of legal obligations applying only on AI systems deemed to be “high-risk”. Customer interaction and agent productivity features offered by Zendesk are generally not viewed as “high-risk,” and indeed chatbots have been specifically referenced as an example of a limited risk AI system under the EU AI Act (subject primarily to transparency requirements which Zendesk already meets). We encourage customers to conduct their own impact assessments in light of their specific industries and use cases.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-4-25
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-4-25
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Copilot
  • AI agents and knowledge
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

Copilot

New:

  • Auto assist:
    • Upgraded to the GPT 4.1 model for better instruction following and increased processing speed.

Fixed:

  • Intelligent triage:
    • Intents: Fixed deactivated intents from being predicted.
    • Intents: Increase description length limit to 650 characters on custom intent use cases

AI agents and knowledge

New:

  • New settings for AI Agents Advanced web crawler imports.

Fixed:

  • Agentic AI Agents EAP: Fixed a bug where actions with names exceeding 64 characters failed to trigger within generative procedures.
  • Fixed the broken link to the help center on the navigation bar under "Help & Resources"
  • Fixed the broken link for "What's new" on the navigation bar under "Help & Resources"
  • Fixed a bug where escalations didn't happen in email conversations when the status was "Recognized intent."
  • Ultimate integration was showing as not integrated, even when an integration was set up. This has now been fixed.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Smart Links (Support) (paid)
    • Smart Links gives you quick and easy access to valuable tools or queries through Smart Links dynamic URLs.  You can leverage Zendesk data about the current ticket, user, customer, or from custom fields to formulate dynamic URLs, making it seamless for agents to get where they need to go.
  • Remove Attachments (Support)
    • Remove Attachments auto-deletes attachments from open and closed tickets via search. Attachments in Zendesk can quickly pile up — old PDFs, screenshots, and files that bloat storage and increase costs. Many of these sit in closed tickets, where triggers can’t reach them, and manual cleanup is no longer practical.  Remove Attachments by Knots gives you that option. Use Zendesk’s built-in search to find the tickets you want to clean and automatically redact and delete attachments from them. Whether it’s a one-time cleanup or a recurring job, you control your data footprint — no manual effort, no custom scripts.
  • Admin Suite (Support) (paid)
    • Admin Suite provides Zendesk administrators with a space and tools to efficiently manage licenses, end users, organizations, and schedules, all in one place, without navigating through Zendesk's Admin Center modules.
  • JMI (Support)
    • JMI is a customer service collaboration platform designed for Amazon sellers.  This integration allows customer service to directly view order information from JMI related to the current work order while processing the work order.
  • Wiz (Support)
    • Wiz enables organizations to automatically create prioritized security tickets for developers and other teams directly in Zendesk. Wiz surfaces critical Issues by correlating risks across misconfigurations, identities, sensitive data, and more, identifying toxic combinations that pose the highest threat. With all the necessary context provided, teams can quickly understand why an Issue is critical and focus their efforts on remediation.
  • Achille AI (Support)
    • Achille AI transforms e-commerce customer support by integrating advanced AI capabilities directly into your existing tools. Designed to enhance responsiveness and efficiency, Achille.ai simplifies support management and ticket classification in over 30 languages, directly from your enterprise tools.  Enable features like Co-Pilot, AI-powered Automation, Multilingual Support, reports and insights, and more.
  • Pluno (Support)
    • Pluno is a copilot for escalations to JIRA and Slack. Pluno handles escalations for you—one click escalates tickets from Zendesk to Jira or Slack, complete with all the context needed to jump in and fix the issue. A smart summary is auto-compiled from a customizable escalation template—context intact, so the receiving team has everything to act immediately. Pluno keeps customers informed automatically, without manually tracking JIRA or Slack, boosting efficiency, reducing missed updates, and improving response times and satisfaction.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Talk
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA
  • Zendesk WFM

articles.name: Announcing reporting for omnichannel routing queues
articles.title: Announcing reporting for omnichannel routing queues
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
April 28, 2025 April 28. 2025 April 28, 2025

We're excited to announce new reports for omnichannel routing queues.

With omnichannel routing queues, you have more flexibility to route and prioritize work for agents to reach their required service levels.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

In this release, we've added a prebuilt reporting dashboard to help you monitor how well omnichannel routing queues distribute work to agents. Supervisors can use this dashboard to understand the inbound and outbound volume of queues, average and longest wait times for any given queue, and drill down to tickets within the queue to understand why the ticket entered or exited the queue.

Additionally, you can access metrics and attributes that enable you to create your own reports.

Talk tickets are not captured by the omnichannel routing queues dataset. This is planned for a future release.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Managers need historical reports to evaluate queue performance and improve future queue configurations. With a growing number of customers enabling omnichannel queues, visibility into how this configuration improves routing efficiency is essential. 

What do I need to do?

After this release, you'll find the omnichannel routing queues dashboard in your dashboard library.

See the following articles for details about the new reports and the metrics and attributes you can use to build your own reports:

  • Analyzing omnichannel routing queues
  • Metrics and attributes for omnichannel routing queues

If you have feedback or questions about this announcement, visit our community forum, where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: About analytics for advanced AI agents
articles.title: About analytics for advanced AI agents
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on AI agents - Advanced

The AI agents - Advanced add-on includes multiple dashboards that help you analyze different aspects of the performance of your advanced AI agents. This article introduces you to the available dashboards and provides links to more in-depth information about each.

This article contains the following topics:

  • About the Performance overview dashboard
  • About the Performance summary dashboard
  • About the Conversation journey dashboard
  • About the UltimateGPT performance dashboard

About the Performance overview dashboard

Available for all advanced AI agent types

The Performance overview dashboard is the main landing page when you access the AI agents - Advanced add-on. Here, you can get an at-a-glance view of important performance metrics for any AI agent across your organization, including:

  • Visitor, email, and conversation volumes
  • Automated resolutions
  • AI agent-handled, deflection, and escalation rates

For more in-depth information about this dashboard, see Analyzing advanced AI agents with the Performance overview dashboard.

About the Performance summary dashboard

Available for all advanced AI agent types

The Performance summary dashboard lets you dig deep into many different aspects of an advanced AI agent to see how well it’s performing. From here, you can view:

  • Key metrics about visitor volume, conversation management, and opportunities for improvement
  • Visualizations based on volume, time, language, resolution, and intent
  • Key metrics about use case performance

For more in-depth information about this dashboard, see Analyzing advanced AI agent performance with the Performance summary dashboard.

About the Conversation journey dashboard

Available only for zero-training and expression-based AI agents

The Conversation journey dashboard provides an aggregated view of all conversations between your AI agent and users. This dashboard helps you investigate your conversation flows to:

  • Understand how many customers go through each dialogue
  • Identify patterns and problem areas
  • Track drop-off rates

For more in-depth information about this dashboard, see Analyzing conversation flows for advanced AI agents with the conversation journey dashboard.

About the UltimateGPT performance dashboard

Available only for zero-training and expression-based AI agents

The UltimateGPT performance dashboard gives you insights into UltimateGPT responses within the conversations between your AI agents and users. This dashboard shows you:

  • How many conversations included UltimateGPT responses
  • How well UltimateGPT understood users’ questions
  • Which topics from your help center were referenced most often in UltimateGPT responses
  • Which topics need to be created in your help center to be used in future UltimateGPT responses

For more in-depth information about this dashboard, see Analyzing UltimateGPT performance for advanced AI agents.

articles.name: Why hidden conversation fields are ignored in Messaging Metadata?
articles.title: Why hidden conversation fields are ignored in Messaging Metadata?
articles.body:
Question

Why are hidden conversation fields ignored in Messaging Metadata for branching AI Agent responses?

Answer

AI Agent cannot reference a conversation field if the ticket field is not included in the logic flow or visible to the user.

You can use the Sunshine Conversations API to retrieve the metadata set on a conversation after calling the Set Conversation Fields API during widget load.

To retrieve the metadata:

  1. Select the option the Make API call. 
  2. Configure the API call to get conversation API.
  3. Use Sunshine Conversations variables to set app_id and conversation_id in the API URL.
  4. Set up the API call authentication by configuring a conversation key.
  5. Store the conversation key as a connection.
  6. Make a test API call to save the conversation field in the "Metadata" JSON attribute as a variable, formatted as zenticket_field{ticket_id}
  7. Use this variable for branching conditions

articles.name: Activating and deactivating Agent Home
articles.title: Activating and deactivating Agent Home
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Suite Any plan
Support Any plan

Agent Home provides useful information to help your agents manage their tickets and view recently-completed work. Think of it as a personal command center to keep agents up-to-date and help them prioritize work. For more information, see Using Agent Home.

Admins can activate or deactivate Agent Home. When activated, Agent Home replaces the legacy agent dashboard in your account.

Agent Home

Legacy agent dashboard

This article includes these sections:

  • Activating Agent Home
  • Deactivating Agent Home

Related articles:

  • Support recipe: Creating a view to replicate the legacy agent dashboard
  • Support recipe: Creating a view to show CSAT ratings without the legacy agent dashboard

Activating Agent Home

Agent Home is activated by default in most accounts. When activated, agents will see Agent Home instead of the legacy agent dashboard.

To activate Agent Home

  1. In Admin Center, click Workspaces in the sidebar, then select Agent tools > Agent interface.
  2. Scroll to Agent Home, then select Enable Agent Home.

  3. Click Save.

Deactivating Agent Home

When you deactivate Agent Home, agents will see the legacy agent dashboard instead of Agent Home.

To deactivate Agent Home

  1. In Admin Center, click Workspaces in the sidebar, then select Agent tools > Agent interface.
  2. Scroll to Agent Home, then deselect Enable Agent Home.

  3. Click Save.

articles.name: What is the forum topic ticket channel?
articles.title: What is the forum topic ticket channel?
articles.body:
Question

Forum topic is available in the Ticket Channel field when I create a trigger. What does this mean?

Answer

Forum topic refers to the original version of the web portal for end users. This portal is now deprecated, and our product Guide is available instead. When you create a trigger, use Ticket > Channel | is | Help Center post to detect tickets created from the following actions in the help center:

  • An article comment
  • A community post
  • A community post comment

For more information, see these articles: 

  • About Zendesk channels
  • Ticket trigger conditions and actions reference

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-4-18
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-4-18
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

App Marketplace

New:
  • Boris (Theme)
    • Boris features extensive customization options with easy color scheme adjustments, modular content blocks, and multiple layout variations, while delivering premium elements like animated hover effects, intuitive navigation, and mobile-responsive design.
  • New York (Theme)
    • New York is a clean, modern theme that puts content first with a bold layout and ultra-readable typography. Inspired by editorial design and city sleekness, New York is a bold and structured Zendesk theme built for clarity and ease of use. Its large headings, intuitive layout, and pixel-perfect spacing make it ideal for companies that want their help centers to feel premium and professional. Fully responsive and deeply customizable, it adapts effortlessly to any brand style, whether minimal or colorful.
  • Houston (Theme)
    • Houston is a soft, dark-mode Zendesk theme that blends warmth and clarity for a calm, content-focused experience.   Houston takes a thoughtful approach to dark theme design — pairing muted tones and rounded blocks with a clear, modern layout emphasizing readability and structure. It’s ideal for teams that want their documentation and support center to feel polished but approachable. Fully responsive and easy to customize, Houston is great for internal knowledge bases, customer support hubs, or any brand that values substance with style.
  • Seattle (Theme)
    • Seattle is a minimalist, content-first Zendesk theme for organized, reliable, documentation-heavy support centers. Seattle offers a clean, content-focused design to support deep documentation and clear navigation. With a neutral color palette, wide layout, and subtle styling, it’s perfect for knowledge bases prioritizing readability and user flow. Seattle adapts seamlessly to your brand and scales beautifully across devices, making it ideal for teams that want a professional, low-maintenance theme focusing on content clarity.
  • Boston (Theme)
    • Boston is a bold, warm-toned Zendesk theme built for teams that want personality and structure in their documentation. Boston stands out with its unique color blocking, sharp layout, and modern serif-sans pairing — perfect for brands that want their help center to feel both editorial and functional. Whether you're supporting thousands of users or just getting started, Boston’s structured grid, responsive design, and customization-ready framework make it a strong choice for teams who want their documentation to feel intentional and on-brand.
  • Las Vegas (Theme)
    • Las Vegas is a dark, sleek Zendesk theme designed for high-impact documentation and a polished support experience.  Las Vegas delivers a visually striking dark theme with sharp contrast, elegant layout, and smooth UI elements that feel both high-end and high-performance. Ideal for teams who take documentation seriously but want a modern edge, it combines clarity with style across every device. From tech brands to SaaS platforms, Las Vegas gives your help center that unmistakable “top shelf” look while keeping everything highly functional and easy to navigate.
  • Miami (Theme)
    • Miami is a bold, dark-mode Zendesk theme with vintage flair and a modern, mobile-ready layout.  Miami fuses retro aesthetics with cutting-edge functionality, delivering a high-contrast dark theme that feels nostalgic and fresh. Rounded cards, soft borders, and playful typography give it personality. At the same time, its responsive structure and pixel-perfect design make it a strong choice for teams who want their support center to look as stylish as it is usable. Miami is ideal for creative brands, lifestyle businesses, or anyone who wants to break away from the ordinary.
  • Los Angeles (Theme)
    • Los Angeles is a bright, elegant Zendesk theme with a soft aesthetic and strong focus on usability and structure.  Los Angeles delivers a clean, uplifting interface that balances form and function. Its airy layout, well-defined sections, and clear hierarchy make it perfect for brands that want their help center to feel easy, friendly, and high-end. Whether you're focused on support documentation, onboarding guides, or community content, Los Angeles keeps everything accessible and organized while staying visually fresh and on-brand.
  • Chicago (Theme)
    • Chicago is a bold, dark-mode Zendesk theme designed for modern brands that want to stand out with style.  With its dark mode aesthetic and glowing accent colors, Chicago brings a sleek, high-contrast look to your help center. Built for performance and visual impact, this theme is fully responsive, highly customizable, and crafted with precision for a premium support experience. Whether you're in tech, gaming, or e-commerce, Chicago sets the tone for a help center that feels sharp and forward-thinking.
  • Denver (Theme)
    • Denver is a clean and modern Zendesk theme built for efficient navigation and effortless access to documentation. Denver is designed for clarity and speed, with a structured grid layout and easy-to-read typography that helps users find answers fast. Perfect for knowledge base–driven support centers, this theme prioritizes organized content, seamless search, and full mobile responsiveness. Whether you’re scaling support or refining internal docs, Denver is built to deliver a smooth, professional experience from top to bottom.
  • Atlanta (Theme)

Its soft background tones, friendly fonts, and numbered blocks create a welcoming support experience for users of all ages and industries. Whether you're running a tech startup, e-commerce store, or creative business, Atlanta’s responsive layout and polished details give your help center both personality and performance.

articles.name: Managing content tags
articles.title: Managing content tags
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Suite Growth, Professional, Enterprise, or Enterprise Plus
Support with Guide, any plan

Content tags are descriptive terms that you can assign to articles and posts to group them by a common attribute. If you've created content tags, you can edit, delete, or merge them as needed.

This article covers the following topics:

  • Editing content tags
  • Deleting content tags
  • Merging content tags

Editing content tags

You can edit content tags if you want to change the name of the tag. When updated, the new name will appear in all places where the content tag appears.

To edit a content tag
  1. In Knowledge admin, click Arrange content () in the sidebar.
  2. Click Manage content tags to display a list of your current content tags.
  3. On the content tag you want to edit, click the options menu (), then select Edit.

  4. If you want to view a list of articles and posts that use the content tag you are about to edit, click View tagged content.

  5. In the Name field, enter the name you want to assign to the content tag, then click Save.

    All articles and posts that use that tag will be updated with the new tag name.

Deleting content tags

You can delete content tags if you no longer want them to appear in your help center. When you delete a content tag it is removed from all articles and posts to which it was applied. To view a list of content that will be affected prior to deletion, see Editing content tags.

To delete a content tag

  1. In Knowledge admin, click Arrange content () in the sidebar.
  2. Click Manage content tags to display a list of your current content tags.
  3. On the content tag you want to delete, click the options menu (), then select Delete.

  4. Review the warning message, then click Delete content tag.

    The content tag is removed from all articles and posts on which it appeared.

To delete content tags in bulk

  1. In Knowledge admin, click Arrange content () in the sidebar.
  2. Click Manage content tags to display a list of your current content tags.
  3. From the content tags list, select the content tags that you want to delete.

  4. At the bottom of the page, click Delete.

  5. Review the warning message, then click Delete content tags.

    The content tags are removed from all articles and posts on which they appeared.

Merging content tags

You can merge content tags if you want to combine duplicate or related tags into a single tag without losing track of the content associated with each tag. When you merge content tags, you retain the name of the tag that you are merging to, and the tags that you merged from are deleted.

To merge a content tag

  1. In Knowledge admin, click Arrange content () in the sidebar.
  2. Click Manage content tags to display a list of your current content tags.
  3. Click the options menu () on the tag that you want to merge into another tag, then select Merge.

  4. In Merge content tag, select the content tag into which you want to merge the tag.

  5. Click Merge content tag.

    The content tag is merged. The original content tag is deleted and content associated with it is moved to the merged tag.

To merge content tags in bulk
  1. In Knowledge admin, click Arrange content () in the sidebar.
  2. Click Manage content tags to display a list of your current content tags.
  3. From the content tags list, select the tags that you want to merge into another tag.
  4. At the bottom of the page, click Merge.

  5. In Merge content tag, select the content tag into which you want to merge your selected tags.

  6. Click Merge content tags.

    The content tags are merged. The original content tags are deleted and content associated with them is moved to the merged tag.

articles.name: Service Incident - April 17, 2025 - All Pods | ZAF SDK - Apps not loading and 404 errors
articles.title: Service Incident - April 17, 2025 - All Pods | ZAF SDK - Apps not loading and 404 errors
articles.body:
SUMMARY

On April 17, 2025 from 9:15 AM UTC to 9:22 AM UTC, customers of Zendesk Support reported apps not loading and 404 error responses from the Zendesk Application Framework Software Development Kit (ZAF SDK).

Timeline

April 17, 2025 10:01 AM UTC | April 17, 2025 03:01 AM PT

We received reports from some of our customers that they are receiving 400 errors when trying to use our ZAF SDK. Our engineering team has identified the issue and is working on a resolution.

April 17, 2025 10:07 AM UTC | April 17, 2025 03:07 AM PT

We are pleased to announce that our engineering team has successfully identified and resolved the root cause of the issue that led to some customers experiencing 404 errors while using our ZAF SDK.

April 17, 2025 10:27 AM UTC | April 17, 2025 03:27 AM PT
Thank you for your patience as our engineering team monitored system behavior following their recent fix. We are pleased to inform you that this issue is now resolved. Should you continue to experience any issues with the ZAF SDK or applications reliant on it, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by a web engine configuration that handles our application framework assets not being properly migrated to the visitor management and delivery tool, which resulted in the 404 error responses to our customers.

Resolution

To fix this issue, our engineers cancelled the scheduled deployment and rolled back the migration. These actions reverted all metrics back to normal and the migration was effectively undone.

Remediation Items

  1. Migrate application framework assets to a new distributed proxy .
  2. Transfer the asset framework into a dedicated segment in the next scheduled deployment.
  3. Add the new asset framework configuration to the reverse proxy.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Do I need authorization from Zendesk to perform a penetration test?
articles.title: Do I need authorization from Zendesk to perform a penetration test?
articles.body:
Question

I would like to perform a penetration test. Do I need authorization from Zendesk?

Answer

No, you don't need authorization from Zendesk to perform a penetration test. You can perform this test anytime, but the Zendesk team recommends avoiding Thursdays. Zendesk usually runs deployments on Thursdays, which may cause scanners to report false positives or false negatives.

To do the test, you must abide by the terms of the Responsible Disclosure Policy and ensure you follow the HackerOne guidelines:

  • No test likely to cause service outages for other tenants will be tolerated, such as DoS, DDoS, or RDDoS
  • Social engineering Zendesk or sub-contractor activities aren't allowed

Once you complete the test, submit your results to security@zendesk.com so the team can identify any issues.

articles.name: Editing and managing filters in Zendesk QA
articles.title: Editing and managing filters in Zendesk QA
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on Quality Assurance (QA) or Workforce Engagement Management (WEM)
Quick Look: Zendesk QA > Conversations

Custom filters in Zendesk QA allow you to quickly locate specific conversations for review based on your chosen criteria. By setting up these filters, you streamline your review process and ensure that you focus on the conversations that matter most. For a comprehensive list of filters and their functions see Understanding conversation filter types in Zendesk QA.

Besides adding new filters, you can also edit, delete, clone, and rearrange your filters to customize the order.

This article contains the following topics:
  • Editing filters in Zendesk QA
  • Duplicating custom filters
  • Deleting custom filters
  • Reordering your filters

Editing filters in Zendesk QA

To edit a filter in Zendesk QA
  1. In Quality Assurance, click Conversations in the sidebar.
  2. Click the Toggle sidebar icon () to display the side menu.
  3. Click Public filters or Private filters to display a list of your public or private filters.
  4. Next to the filter you want to change, click the options menu () and select Edit.

  5. Edit the name and modify the visibility, and conditions of your filter as needed.
  6. Click Save changes.
    Click Turn into assignment to create a copy of this filter as a new assignment. The new assignment is automatically added to your Tasks list.

Duplicating custom filters

To duplicate a custom filter
  1. In Quality Assurance, click Conversations in the sidebar.
  2. Click the Toggle sidebar icon () to display the side menu.
  3. Click Public filters or Private filters to display a list of your public or private filters.
  4. Next to the filter you want to clone, click the options menu () and select Duplicate.

    A copy of your filter is automatically added to your Private filters list.

Deleting custom filters

To delete a custom filter
  1. In Quality Assurance, click Conversations in the sidebar.
  2. Click the Toggle sidebar icon () to display the side menu.
  3. Click Public filters or Private filters to display a list of your public or private filters.
  4. Next to the filter you want to delete, click the options menu () and select Delete.

    The filter is deleted and removed from your list of filters.

Reordering your filters

You can adjust the order of your filters according to your preference.

To rearrange the order of your filters

  1. In Quality Assurance, click Conversations in the sidebar.
  2. Click the Toggle sidebar icon () to display the side menu.
  3. Click Public filters or Private filters to display a list of your public or private filters.
  4. To modify the order of your filters, simply click on a filter and rearrange the order by dragging it.

articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for some customers using Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) on Pods 13, 17, 19, 20 and 23 from May 5 to May 7, 2025, during the time listed below.

Affected products: Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging)

Important: Only customers with Messaging triggers enabled are impacted by this maintenance window. Admins can check this by browsing to the Messaging triggers page under Admin Center>>Objects and rules. If you see this page, your account will be impacted by this maintenance. If you do not see it, your account will not be affected.

Customers Affected: Some Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging only) customers using our improved Messaging backend will experience a brief service disruption of 20 minutes at some time within the 2 hour maintenance window.

Expected behavior:

There will be degraded Messaging performance on all Messaging Channels for up to 20 mins during the window, and your agents may experience delayed ticket creation and end user messages sent to Agent Workspace.

No data will be lost due to this process, and service will resume seamlessly once the maintenance completes.

Outside of the specific windows outlined in the table above, customers should not experience any service impact.

What do customers have to do?

Customers are recommended not to set ticket status to Closed for ongoing Messaging tickets that are open during the maintenance window so that any delayed messages can still be appended to the ticket after database maintenance is completed. If an ongoing messaging ticket is closed during the maintenance window, messages not yet appended to the transcript could create a new ticket.

No further action is required.

 

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is performing this maintenance work to improve the stability and scalability (storage capacity and general performance improvements) of datastores in the new Messaging Backend (see article). This allows us to improve reliability and performance for existing and future customers to the new Messaging Backend.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-4-11
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-4-11
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Support
  • AI agents and knowledge
  • App Marketplace
  • Zendesk WFM
  • Products with no updates this week

Support

New:

  • EAP launch of Action Builder, which provides a new and simplified way for teams to manage and automate workflows across multiple systems without requiring any coding.

AI agents and knowledge

New:
  • Dialogue builder versioning is now available, allowing users to save, preview, and restore drafts and published versions and add notes.
  • Changing "Link to reply" nodes to "Link to..." nodes. Sunshine Conversations chat users can now use the "Auto-select reply method" when selecting replies. The option relies on the use case configuration, picking procedures or dialogues based on settings. The option also picks the relevant language reply when using dialogues. Auto-select is unavailable to other CRM users and email automation AI Agents.
Fixed:
  • Fixed issue with intent list frequency not being displayed.
  • Fixed an issue where adding the same bot multiple times for a user was possible.
  • Hid the delete bot button from clientAdmin user to avoid unnecessary 401 errors.
  • Automated resolutions in autoreplies with articles - Tickets created via API and Classic Web Widget channels that utilize the autoreplies with article triggers were previously not counted as automated resolutions if they met the definition.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Torvalds.Dev (Support)
    • Torvalds.Dev helps your Zendesk agents resolve tickets faster and more effectively by providing instant insights from your organization's knowledge base. The app intelligently retrieves relevant information, offering contextual hints and suggestions to streamline ticket resolution.  By analyzing internal data and resources, Torvalds.Dev ensures your agents have the most relevant and up-to-date information, allowing them to craft well-informed responses and resolve issues confidently.
  • Reply Assistant (Support)
    • Reply Assistant empowers agents by using AI to generate smart, context-aware replies based on ticket history. With instant response generation and built-in customization, agents can refine AI-suggested replies before sending them. Available directly in the ticket editor, Reply Assistant helps streamline workflows and improve response efficiency while ensuring customer data remains secure.
  • Hide User Fields (Support)
    • Hide User Fields allows you to hide specific user fields from the agent interface, helping reduce visual clutter and streamline workflows. Whether managing dozens or thousands of users, this tool gives you complete control over which user fields are visible so agents see only the most relevant information.
  • Zoho Lens AR Remote Assistance (Support)
    • Zoho Lens AR Remote Assistance empowers technicians to provide augmented reality (AR) remote assistance directly from Zendesk support tickets. This integration boosts productivity, enhances customer satisfaction, and simplifies complex issue resolution with real-time visual collaboration
  • CXC Latam Insights (Support)
    • CXC Latam Insights helps you instantly analyze your entire Zendesk configuration and detect issues with triggers, automations, macros, routing rules, agent settings, and more, making troubleshooting faster and easier.  Quickly identify and resolve issues without manually reviewing each trigger, automation, or macro. Get clear, actionable insights for immediate solutions—no guesswork!  Get real-time insights into your Zendesk usage, optimize your plan, and maximize your value and efficiency.
  • Accoil (Support) (Sell)
    • Accoil for Support and Sell helps you track customer health based on product usage and identifies high-intent leads and expansion opportunities with usage insights.  Accoil calculates health scores based on product usage, giving support and sales teams clear, actionable insights inside Zendesk Support and Zendesk Sell.
  • Lionbridge Smart Connect Messaging (Support)
    • Lionbridge Smart Connect Messaging provides contact centers, service desks, IT helpdesks, and other organizations with a cost-effective alternative to hiring bilingual staff: AI-based technology. Lionbridge’s translation solution allows organizations to instantly add interaction support for more than 100 languages using their existing staff – with no IT involvement required.  Lionbridge Smart Connect Chat eliminates the need to staff across all languages while providing stakeholders with real-time, low-effort experiences in their native language, with terminology customized for your company and your industry.
  • Archer One (Theme)
    • Archer One provides a modern, responsive layout that makes customizing your help center a breeze. Get started with an engaging design featuring multiple category boxes, along with a fully customizable header and footer. This flexible structure not only helps organize your content in a visually appealing way but also ensures that your users can easily navigate your help center.
  • Revolion (Theme)
    • Revolion is a fully responsive, modern, and professional Zendesk Guide Help Center theme for a seamless customer support experience. Perfect for businesses of all sizes, Revolion empowers organizations to create an intuitive, self-service help center—no coding required. Every element is fully customizable and brand-ready, allowing users to easily launch a professional, on-brand support hub.
  • Thank You Autosolve (Support) (paid)
    • Thank You Autosolve uses AI-driven reasoning to determine whether a reopened ticket’s reply is genuinely a gratitude-only message, where no further action is needed. If it is, the ticket is automatically solved. If not, it remains open for the agent to review.

Zendesk WFM

New:

  • Audit logs: events related to Time off management have been added to the WFM Audit logs page.

Fixed:

  • Reporting and Monitoring:

    • [Report] Fixed a bug that allowed agents to see metrics other than their own in custom reports, even when their permissions did not allow it.

    • [Report] Resolved a bug in the occupancy and utilization calculations; when grouped by activity type only, the calculations were not returning the correct values.

    • [Agent Attendance] The Occupancy Rate metric value is now consistent across the UI (in the Occupancy column and Summary panel) and in the exported CSV files.

    • [Agent Activity] For customers with UAS integration, a bug that caused the incorrect color to display for the "Away" status has been fixed. Previously, "Away" was shown in gray, the color designated for offline statuses.

    • [Agent Activity] For customers with UAS integration, the page now only displays clock-in and clock-out times that reflect the start and end of day events.

    • [WFM Public API EAP] Customers were receiving a 403 error from a problem originating from an issue with the way roles were being set in the request. That is fixed now.
  • Roles and Permissions:
    • Team managers are now part of the team's scope.

Products with no updates this week

  • Talk
  • Advanced AI
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: What trigger conditions and actions are available on the legacy Support Essential plan?
articles.title: What trigger conditions and actions are available on the legacy Support Essential plan?
articles.body:
Question

What trigger conditions and actions are available on the legacy Support Essential plan?

Answer

On the Essential plan, customers are limited to conditions and actions that are present in the default triggers.

The conditions are as follows:

  • Ticket > Assignee
  • Ticket > Comment
  • Ticket > Priority
  • Ticket > Privacy
  • Ticket > Status
  • Ticket > Ticket
  • Ticket details > Current User
  • Requester > Requester

The available actions are as follows:

  • Notify by > User email

For more information on the default triggers, see these articles:

  • About the Support default triggers
  • Trigger conditions and actions reference

articles.name: Activating and deactivating Google Calendar for Zendesk WFM
articles.title: Activating and deactivating Google Calendar for Zendesk WFM
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on Workforce Management (WFM) or Workforce Engagement Management (WEM)

Admins can allow agents to sync their Zendesk WFM intraday schedule with their Google calendar.

To activate or deactivate the Google Calendar integration for Zendesk WFM

  1. In Zendesk WFM, hover over the admin icon () in the navigation bar.
  2. Under Integrations, select or deselect Google Calendar.

  3. If you're deactivating the integration, click Deactivate integration in the dialog that appears.

    When you deactivate the Google Calendar integration, the connection between the agents' schedule and their Google calendars isn't removed. Agents must disconnect their calendars from their schedule as well.

  4. Refresh Zendesk after the integration is activated or deactivated.

    If you've activated the Google Calendar integration for WFM, agents can now sync their Google calendars with their WFM schedules.

articles.name: Service Incident - April 8, 2025 - Zendesk QA | All Pods - Scorecard and review submission failures
articles.title: Service Incident - April 8, 2025 - Zendesk QA | All Pods - Scorecard and review submission failures
articles.body:
Summary

On April 8, 2025 from 12:27 UTC to 16:13 UTC, Zendesk QA customers experienced multiple issues with the product including scorecard loading failures and review submission failures.

Timeline

April 08, 2025 03:02 PM UTC | April 08, 2025 08:02 AM PT
We have received reports of the QA Scorecards failing to load in Zendesk QA on multiple pods. We are currently engaging our engineers to assist with this issue. Investigation is underway. We apologize for this inconvenience and we will be providing the next update in 30 minutes.

April 08, 2025 03:37 PM UTC | April 08, 2025 08:37 AM PT
We continue to investigate the issue of the QA Scorecards failing to load in Zendesk QA on multiple pods. Our engineers have rolled back some potentially problematic changes. We appreciate your patience and we will provide the next update in 30 minutes.

April 08, 2025 04:21 PM UTC | April 08, 2025 09:21 AM PT
We are pleased to inform you that the issue of the QA Scorecards failing to load in Zendesk QA on multiple pods has been resolved. Our engineers confirmed that the fix was successful. We thank you for your patience on this issue.

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by a bug in a recent change to our backend real-time messaging service that manages communication between multiple applications. The issue occurred intermittently when concurrent publishing events were handled.

Resolution

To fix this issue, our team identified the change and rolled our application back to a previous working version. The issue was subsequently fixed prior to re-releasing it back into our product.

Remediation Items

  1. Investigate the possibility of adding a recovery handler to our internal service.
  2. Additional monitoring to catch similar failures if they happen again.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-4-4
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-4-4
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • AI agents and knowledge
  • Advanced AI
  • App Marketplace
  • Zendesk WFM
  • Products with no updates this week

AI agents and knowledge

AI Agents Advanced

New:

  • The new Product Tray (v2) is now available for provisioned customers on AI Agents Advanced.

Fixed:

  • Salesforce escalations were failing when bot shepherd restarted the bot. This has now been fixed.

Knowledge

New:

  • Rollout started for generative search.
  • Updated CSAT strings in Messaging. Instead of the static string “Please rate your conversation,” a CSAT is now shown.
  • We've added the ability to Embedded Figma files in help center articles.

Advanced AI

New:

Similar Tickets

  • Released improvements to the Similar Tickets EAP.

Auto-assist

New:

  • Action linking: Improved action management allows admins to link actions directly in procedures to ensure auto assist performs the correct action.
  • Brand segmentation: Adding brands to procedures is designed to improve the segmentation of procedures and to ensure that auto-assist uses brand-specific procedures to solve brand-specific problems.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Process DOCX (Support)
    • Process DOCX automatically extracts and uses data from DOC and DOCX files by using AI-powered data extraction to automatically process Microsoft Word files – from written and formatted text to images and tables. The extracted information is added to the ticket and can be used to automatically update ticket fields, trigger other automation workflows, or integrate with third-party systems.
  • SATRDÉ Asset Manager (Support) (paid)
    • SATRDÉ Asset Manager lets you download your assets, mass-edit, and view all assets tied to users on tickets by using custom objects. The SATRDÉ Asset Manager is designed to work with the latest version of custom objects. Set up custom objects and download them into CSV files one at a time or simultaneously. Additionally, a ticket sidebar component will display assets tied to the ticket requester. All you have to do is set up your custom object with a customer look-up relationship field.
  • Financedesk (Theme)
    • Financedesk is a fully responsive multipurpose help center (Guide) theme. The theme is the perfect balance between style and performance. The elements of the help center are arranged in a way that keeps navigation super-easy. The theme comes with a refined image on the side of the search box. It has an impressive full-screen layout with beautiful blocks and responsive design elements, which creates a light and refined ambiance in the help center. It follows the latest trends in web design and features a brand-new layout with a long list of features.

Zendesk WFM

New:

  • Audit Logs for Account Settings, User Management, and General Tasks. 

Products with no updates this week

  • Talk
  • Support
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Explore recipe: Adding images and animated GIFs to dashboards
articles.title: Explore recipe: Adding images and animated GIFs to dashboards
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Suite Professional, Enterprise, or Enterprise Plus
Support with Explore Professional or Enterprise
The information in this article covers the new Explore dashboard builder, released in November 2024. The legacy dashboard builder will remain available until Q4 2025. If you’re using the legacy dashboard builder and need help, see About the legacy Explore dashboard builder.

The new Explore dashboard doesn't support adding images (though this is planned for a future release). However, with a bit of work, you can add images and animated GIFS to your dashboard. Adding graphics can help you brand your dashboards or add instructional material using animated GIFS.

Here's an example:

Important: When you add images using the method in this recipe, you cannot export the dashboard or schedule deliveries.

In this recipe, you'll learn how to add images and animated GIFS to an Explore dashboard.

This recipe contains the following topics:

  • What you'll need
  • Getting the images ready
  • Creating the report attributes
  • Building the report
  • Building the dashboard
  • Next steps

What you'll need

Skill level: Intermediate

Time required: 20 minutes

  • Zendesk Explore Professional or Enterprise.
  • Editor or Admin permissions (see Giving agents access to Explore).
  • One or more images or animated GIFS hosted on the web in an accessible location.

Getting the images ready

You'll create each image as a separate report and then add them to your dashboard. Use the following steps to get your images ready to add.

To prepare your images

  1. Resize your image to ensure it doesn't take up too much space on the dashboard. You can't resize the image from the dashboard, so it might take some trial and error to get it to the size that looks best.
  2. Upload your image to an online location accessible to any of your dashboard viewers. For example, you could use Postimages or imgBB to host your images.
  3. Create a new dashboard. Alternatively, you can use an existing dashboard to add images.

Creating the report attributes

You need to create a report for each image you want to add. In this example, you'll create the reports using the Support - Tickets dataset, but you can use any dataset you want.

To create the reports

  1. In Explore, click the reports ( ) icon.
  2. In the Reports library, click New report.
  3. On the Select a dataset page, click Support > Support - Tickets, then click Start report.
    Report builder opens.
  4. In your report, open the Calculations menu (), then click Standard calculated attribute. 
  5. On the Standard calculated attribute page, under Name, enter a name for the attribute, such as Dashboard image. You can change this name later if you want.
  6. In the Formula field, enter or paste one of the following formulas, including the quotes:
    If you want to insert a static image
     
    "<IMG img src=https://<image location>/<image name>>"
    If you want to insert an animated GIF 
    "<IMG img src=https://<image location>/<image name>.gif>"

    Replace <image location> with the URL of your image and replace <image name> with the image file name.

  7. Click the report's title and enter a descriptive name, such as "Myimage".
  8. Click Save.
  9. Continue creating standard calculated attributes for each image you need.

Building the report

Now that you've created your attributes, you can create reports for each image you want to add to a dashboard. 

To build the report

  1. In the Metrics panel of your report, click Add.
  2. From the list of metrics, choose a single metric to add to the report, for example, COUNT(Tickets). This is added because all Explore reports must contain at least one metric. Don't worry; you'll learn how to hide it later.
  3. In the Attributes panel, click Add.
    Choose the attribute you created in the previous section from the list of attributes. 
  4. Click the Visualization type menu () and select Table. Your report will resemble the following screenshot:
  5. You'll notice that the value of your created metric is displayed. To hide this metric, from the Chart configuration menu ( ), click Columns.
  6. On the Columns page, click the eye icon for column 2 to turn off the column display as shown below:

Your report is now displayed without the metric.

Repeat this procedure for any other images or animated GIFS you need.

Building the dashboard

You now have the components you need to build your dashboard. You can add any other Explore components, such as reports and filters, as well as your images and animated GIFS.

To build the dashboard

  1. In a new or existing Explore dashboard, click the + icon, then select Report.
  2. Click the image reports you just created from the list of reports. The reports immediately appear in the dashboard.
  3. Drag, drop, and resize each report to appear as you want.
  4. Continue adding other reports and filters you need.
  5. When you're done, publish and share the dashboard.

It's likely that when you first add the images and GIFS to the dashboard, they will not be the size you need. To fix this, edit the report, then, in the Chart configuration menu ( ), click Chart and adjust the Height and Width until the image is the right size.

Next steps

Feel free to experiment with this recipe. We'd love to see what you come up with! Let us know in the comments below.

articles.name: [Schedule Change] Scheduled Maintenance - April 29-May 1, 2025 | Pods 23 & 13 - Messaging & Sunshine Conversations
articles.title: [Schedule Change] Scheduled Maintenance - April 29-May 1, 2025 | Pods 23 & 13 - Messaging & Sunshine Conversations
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for notified customers on Pods 23 and 13 on April 29 - May 1 2025, during the times listed below.

Affected products: Messaging & Sunshine Conversations

Important: Only customers who have been notified and have Messaging enabled will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below. Impacted customers will receive an in-product banner notification on April 15.
Customers Affected: Zendesk Messaging and Sunshine Conversations customers on Pods 23 and 13 who have been notified, will experience a brief service disruption of 20 minutes at some time within their 30 minute maintenance window. Each account will only be impacted by one window, and the specific time is included in a banner alert in the Support product. If you do not receive this alert, you are not impacted.

Expected behavior: During the maintenance window, notified accounts attempting to use Messaging will find their accounts locked and unable to send outbound messages and instead will receive an HTTP 423 response. Messages sent by end-users via social messaging channels for these accounts will be preserved and buffered until the account is unlocked.

What do customers have to do? If customers have have enabled their own client-side Content Security Policy than they must include *.zendesk.com on their allowlist to ensure that their integrations continue to initialize and function.

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is rehoming customers accounts to be located in the same data store as their Support accounts for increased reliability, performance & data locality.

articles.name: Service Incident - April 4, 2025 - All Pods | Meta integrations - Disconnection of Meta apps and failures to reconnect
articles.title: Service Incident - April 4, 2025 - All Pods | Meta integrations - Disconnection of Meta apps and failures to reconnect
articles.body:
SUMMARY

On April 4, 2025 from 10:25 UTC to April 5, 2025 2:13 UTC, customers in all Pods experienced Meta app integrations with Zendesk disconnecting, and were unable to reconnect.

TIMELINE

April 05, 2025 02:13 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 07:13 PM PT
We have been working continuously with our partner provider to address the issue causing Meta apps (Facebook and Instagram) to become unauthorized in Zendesk. We are pleased to report functionality has been restored. If you are experiencing connectivity issues with your Facebook Pages integration, we encourage you to reconnect the pages to your account. Please let us know if there continue to be any errors or issues. Thank you.

April 04, 2025 06:34 PM UTC | April 04, 2025 11:34 AM PT
Our teams are still working with our partner provider to address the issue causing Meta apps (Facebook and Instagram) to become unauthorized in Zendesk. We apologize for any disruption this may be causing and thank you for your continued patience. We will post additional information as soon as we have a substantive update to share.

April 04, 2025 02:05 PM UTC | April 04, 2025 07:05 AM PT
We are continuously investigating the issue with Meta apps (Facebook and Instagram) being unauthorized in Zendesk Support. Our third-party partners are actively investigating on their end to mitigate the issue. We appreciate your patience and understanding on this ongoing issue. We will provide updates as it becomes available.

April 04, 2025 12:50 PM UTC | April 04, 2025 05:50 AM PT
We have discovered that the issue with Facebook being unauthorized in Zendesk Support has extended to other Meta apps (Instagram). Our team is currently investigating the issue. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience and understanding. We will provide updates as it becomes available.

April 04, 2025 11:33 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 04:33 AM PT
We are still investigating the extent of the issue with the Facebook app showing unauthorized in Zendesk Support issue at the moment. Our team is close to identifying the underlying cause and are engaged with our third party support. We appreciate your patience on this ongoing issue and will provide the next update as it becomes available.

April 04, 2025 10:57 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 03:57 AM PT
We are investigating the issue of Facebook pages becoming unauthorized in Zendesk Support on multiple pods. Our team is currently identifying the underlying cause. Thank you for your patience. Next update in 30 minutes.

April 04, 2025 10:25 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 03:25 AM PT
We have received reports of Facebook pages becoming unauthorized in Zendesk Support on multiple pods. Investigation is underway. Please consider replying to your Facebook end users in Facebook for the time being. Next update in 30 mins.


POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

This incident occurred due to connectivity issues with Zendesk’s Business Manager account in Meta, resulting in customer Meta apps integrated with their Zendesk account also disconnecting. Zendesk customers were unable to reconnect until the connection was restored between Zendesk and Meta.

 

Resolution

To fix this issue, we worked closely with our partner provider to restore functionality. After thorough investigation and collaboration, we successfully reestablished the connection between Zendesk and the Meta apps, allowing users to reconnect their Meta apps to their Zendesk accounts.

 

Remediation Items

  1. Implement a monitoring system to detect connectivity issues with third-party integrations proactively.
  2. Establish a communication protocol with our partner providers for faster resolution of similar issues in the future.
  3. Develop a contingency plan for users experiencing connectivity issues, including clear instructions for reconnecting their accounts.


FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.
